sen.j: 六波羅蜜寺 (ろくはらみつじ)は、京都市東山区にある真言宗智山派の寺院である。
sen.e: Rokuharamitsu-ji is a temple of the Chisan branch of the Shingon Sect located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City
Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple is a temple of the Chisan branch of the Shingon Sect located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: Templeを補足。ピリオドを補足。
sen.e: Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple is a temple of the Chisan branch of the Shingon Sect located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 山号は補陀洛山。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Fudarakusan'.
sen.cmt: ・Fudarakusan: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Fudarakusan.'
Its honorific mountain prefix is Fudarakusan.

sen.j: 本尊は十一面観音。
sen.e: The principal image is the eleven-face Kannon.
The principal image is the eleven-face Kannon.
The principal image is the eleven-face Kannon.

sen.j: 開基（創立者）は空也（くうや）。
sen.e: The temple was founded by Kuya.
The temple was founded by Kuya.
The temple was founded by Kuya.

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第17番札所。
sen.e: It is the 17th of the 33 temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 17th sacred place of the 33 temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 17th sacred place of the 33 temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.

sen.j: 踊り念仏で知られる市聖（いちひじり）空也（くうや）が平安時代中期の天暦5年（951年）に造立した十一面観音を本尊とする道場に由来し、当初西光寺と称した。
sen.e: The temple originated from Saiko-ji Temple dedicated to the eleven-face Kannon founded in the year 951 by monk Kuya who was known for chanting the name of Buddha while beating a bell and dancing.

The temple originated from a training hall dedicated to the eleven-face Kannon founded in the year 951 (in the mid-Heian period) by monk Kuya ICHIHIJIRI who was known for chanting the name of Buddha while beating a bell and dancing, and was called Saiko-ji Temple at first.
sen.cmt: Kuya→Kuya ICHIHIJIRI平安時代中期の→in the mid-Heian period を補足。"道場に由来し、当初西光寺と称した"部分の英訳を訂正しました。
sen.e: The temple originated from a training hall dedicated to the eleven-face Kannon founded in the year 951 (in the mid-Heian period) by monk Kuya ICHIHIJIRI who was known for chanting the name of Buddha while beating a bell and dancing, and was called Saiko-ji Temple at first.

sen.j: 空也は疫病の蔓延（まんえん）する当時の京都で、この観音像を車に乗せて引きながら歩き、念仏を唱え、病人に茶をふるまって多くの人を救ったという。
sen.e: As the plague spread throughout Kyoto, it is said that Kuya put the Kannon statue on a wagon which he pulled as he walked around helping people - chanting the name of Buddha and distributing tea to the sick.

As the plague spread throughout Kyoto, it is said that Kuya put the Kannon statue on a wagon which he pulled as he walked around helping people - chanting the name of Buddha and distributing tea to the sick.

As the plague spread throughout Kyoto, it is said that Kuya put the Kannon statue on a wagon which he pulled as he walked around helping people, chanting the name of Buddha and distributing tea to the sick.

sen.j: 空也は応和3年（963年）に鴨川 (淀川水系)岸に僧600名を集めて大規模な大般若経供養会を行ったが、この時をもって西光寺の創建とする説もある。
sen.e: In the year 963, Kuya assembled 600 monks on the bank of Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) and held a commemoration ceremony of Daihannya sutras, which some theories consider the establishment of Saiko-ji Temple.

In the year 963, Kuya assembled 600 monks on the bank of Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) and held a commemoration ceremony of Daihannya sutras, which some theories consider the establishment of Saiko-ji Temple.

In the year 963, Kuya assembled 600 monks on the bank of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) and held a large-scale commemoration ceremony of Daihannya sutras, which some theories consider the establishment of Saiko-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: large-scale補足"Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 当時、鴨川の岸は遺体の捨て場であり、葬送の場であった。
sen.e: At that time, the bank of Kamo-gawa River was a funeral site where remains of the dead were left.
At that time, the bank of Kamo-gawa River was a funeral site where remains of the dead were left.
At that time, the bank of the Kamo-gawa River was a funeral site where remains of the dead were left.
sen.cmt: "Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 空也の死後、977年に比叡山の僧・中信 (僧)が中興して天台別院とし、六波羅蜜寺と改称した。
sen.e: After the death of Kuya, a monk from Mt. Hiei named Chuhsin renovated the temple as a Tendai branch temple and renamed it Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple in the year 977.
After the death of Kuya, a monk from Mt. Hiei named Chuhsin renovated the temple as a Tendai branch temple and renamed it Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple in the year 977.
After the death of Kuya, a monk from Mt. Hiei named Chusin renovated the temple as a Tendai branch temple and renamed it Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple in the year 977.

sen.j: それ以降天台宗に属したが、桃山時代に真言宗智積院の末寺となった。
sen.e: From then on it served as a Tendai Sect temple before becoming a branch of the Shingon Sect Chishaku-in Temple in the Momoyama period.
From then on it served as a Tendai Sect temple before becoming a branch of the Shingon Sect Chishaku-in Temple in the Momoyama period.
From then on it served as a Tendai Sect temple before becoming a branch of the Shingon Sect Chishaku-in Temple in the Momoyama period.

sen.j: 平安末にはこの付近に、六波羅館と呼ばれた平清盛ら平家一門の屋敷が営まれた。
sen.e: At the end of the Heian period, TAIRA no Kiyomori of the Heike clan built a mansion named Rokuhara-kan in the area.
At the end of the Heian period, TAIRA no Kiyomori of the Heike clan built a mansion named Rokuhara-kan in the area.
At the end of the Heian period, TAIRA no Kiyomori of the Taira family built a mansion named Rokuhara-kan in the area.
sen.cmt: clan→family"Heike family"→"Taira family"に変更しました。

sen.j: またのちに鎌倉幕府によって六波羅探題が置かれたのもこの付近である。
sen.e: The Rokuhara Tandai agency was also established in the area by the Kamakura Shogunate.
The Rokuhara Tandai agency was also established in the area by the Kamakura Shogunate.
The Rokuhara Tandai agency was also established in the area by the Kamakura Shogunate.

sen.j: 名称は仏教の教義「六波羅蜜」という語に由来するが、この地を古来「六原」と称したことに由来するとも考えられている。
sen.e: The name is based on the Buddhist Rokuharamitsu (the Six Perfections), but there are those who believe the origin to lie in the ancient name of the area 'Rokuhara'.
The name is based on the Buddhist Rokuharamitsu (the Six Perfections), but there are those who believe the origin to lie in the ancient name of the area 'Rokuhara.'
The name is based on the Buddhist Rokuharamitsu (the Six Perfections), but there are those who believe the origin to lie in the ancient name of the area 'Rokuhara.'

sen.j: なお、六波羅密寺とする表記が古今多く見られるが、誤字である。
sen.e: An alternative character for 'mitsu' of the name of Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple has also been commonly used but this is incorrect.
An alternative character for 'mitsu' of the name of Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple has also been commonly used but this is incorrect.
An alternative character for 'mitsu' of the name of Rokuharamitsu-ji Temple has also been commonly used but this is incorrect.

sen.j: 江戸時代までは伽藍を連ねたが、明治維新の廃仏毀釈を受けて大幅に寺域を縮小した。
sen.e: Until the Edo period, the temple included a monastery but the precinct was greatly reduced due to the Haibutsu kishaku (anti-Buddhist movement) of the Meiji Restoration.
Until the Edo period, the temple included a monastery but the precinct was greatly reduced due to the Haibutsu kishaku (anti-Buddhist movement) of the Meiji Restoration.
Until the Edo period, the temple included a monastery but the precinct was greatly reduced due to the Haibutsu kishaku (anti-Buddhist movement) of the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 現在、寺の周囲は民家に囲まれて境内は狭く、主な建物は本堂（南北朝時代 (日本)、重文）と宝物収蔵庫のみである。
sen.e: The now narrow precinct is surrounded by houses and its only main buildings are the Hon-do (main hall - an Important Cultural Property dating from Japan's Nanbokucho period) and the treasure hall.
The now narrow precinct is surrounded by houses and its only main buildings are the Hon-do (main hall - an Important Cultural Property dating from Japan's Nanbokucho period) and the treasure hall.

The now narrow precinct is surrounded by houses and its only main buildings are the Hon-do (main hall - an Important Cultural Property dating from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)) and the treasure hall.
sen.cmt: "Japan's Nanbokucho period"→"the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)"に変更しました。

sen.j: 本堂は、外陣を板敷きとし、蔀戸で仕切られた内陣を一段低い四半敷き土間とする天台式建築で貞治2年（1363年）の再建である。
sen.e: The main hall is a Tendai Sect style building rebuilt in 1363 with a wooden-floored gejin (accessible front outer area) separated from the square tile floored naijin (inner sanctum) by wooden lattice shutters.

The main hall is a Tendai Sect style building rebuilt in 1363 with the Gejin (outer place of worship for public people), which has a wooden-floor, separated from the Naijin (inner sanctum), which has Shihanjiki Doma (squared masonry jointed dirt floor) on the lower level, by wooden lattice shutters.
sen.cmt: 下陣→Gejin (outer place of worship for public people)四半敷き土間→Shihanjiki Doma (squared masonry jointed dirt floor) 用語集その他より一段低い→lower levelを補足。
sen.e: The main hall is a Tendai Sect style building rebuilt in 1363 with the Gejin (outer place of worship for public people), which has a wooden-floor, separated from the Naijin (inner sanctum), which has Shihanjiki Doma (squared masonry jointed dirt floor) on the lower level, by wooden lattice shutters.

sen.j: 国宝の本尊像以外にも、空也上人像、伝・平清盛像、運慶の真作と見なされる地蔵菩薩坐像など日本彫刻史上著名な仏像、肖像を有する。
sen.e: The temple's National Treasures include portraits and statues that are highly regarded within the world of Japanese sculpture such as the statue of the principal image, the statue of Kuya Jonin, the statue of TAIRA no Kiyomori and a sitting statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha considered to be an original piece by Unkei.
sen.cmt: ・National Treasures: 英辞郎 on the WEB・Unkei: http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=運慶&dtype=0&dname=0na&stype=0&pagenum=1&index=02083601723400
sen.e: The temple's National Treasures include portraits and statues that are highly regarded within the world of Japanese sculpture such as the statue of the principal image, the statue of Kuya Jonin, the statue of TAIRA no Kiyomori and a sitting statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha considered to be an original piece by Unkei.

The temple's National Treasures include portraits and statues that are highly regarded within the world of Japanese sculpture such as the statue of the principal image, the statue of Kuya Jonin, the statue of TAIRA no Kiyomori and a sitting statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha considered to be an original piece by Unkei.

sen.j: 本尊以外の諸仏は宝物収蔵庫（公開）に安置されている。
sen.e: In additon to the principal image, all other Buddhist treasures are housed within the treasure hall (open to the public)
Except the principal image, all other Buddhist treasures are housed within the treasure hall (open to the public).
sen.cmt: 以外→Except ピリオドを補足。
sen.e: Except the principal image, all other Buddhist treasures are housed within the treasure hall (open to the public).

tit.cmt: ・National Treasures: 英辞郎 on the WEB

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像 － 平安時代。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of the eleven-face Kannon - Heian period
Wooden standing statue of the eleven-face Kannon - Heian period.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、ピリオドを補足。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of the eleven-face Kannon - Heian period.

sen.j: 10世紀頃の作風を示し、伝承のとおり、951年に空也が創建した西光寺の本尊像であると思われる。
sen.e: This 10th century style piece is believed to have been, as the legend tells, the principal image of Saiko-ji Temple built by Kuya in the year 951.
This 10th century style piece is believed to have been, as the legend tells, the principal image of Saiko-ji Temple built by Kuya in the year 951.
This 10th century style piece is believed to have been, as the legend tells, the principal image of Saiko-ji Temple built by Kuya in the year 951.

sen.j: 本堂中央の厨子に安置され、12年に一度辰年にのみ開帳される秘仏である。
sen.e: It is housed within a miniature shrine in the center of the main hall and is only unveiled once in the year of the dragon every 12 years.
sen.cmt: ・year of the Dragon: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: It is housed within a miniature shrine in the center of the main hall and is only unveiled once in the year of the dragon every 12 years.
It is housed within a miniature shrine in the center of the main hall and is only unveiled once in the year of the dragon every 12 years.

sen.j: 像高258cmの巨像でありながら、頭・体の根幹部を一材から彫り出す一木造とする。
sen.e: Despite its height of 258cm, the head, body and limbs are all carved from a single piece of wood.
Despite its height of 258cm, the head, body and limbs are all carved from a single piece of wood.
Despite its height of 258 cm, the head, body and limbs are all carved from a single piece of wood.
sen.cmt: 単位の前にスペース挿入

sen.j: 表情は温和であり、平安前期彫刻から平安後期の和様彫刻に至る過渡期を代表する作例である。
sen.e: It has a gentle expression and is highly representative of the transitional period of Japanese style carving that took place from before the beginning of to just after the end of the Heian period.
It has a gentle expression and is highly representative of the transitional period of Japanese style carving that took place from before the beginning of to just after the end of the Heian period.
It has a gentle expression and is highly representative of the transitional period of Japanese style carving that took place from before the beginning of to just after the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 歴史的にも重要な作例として1999年、国宝に指定された。
sen.e: It is also an extremely valuable historic piece and was designated a National Treasure in 1999.
sen.cmt: ・National Treasures: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: It is also an extremely valuable historic piece and was designated a National Treasure in 1999.
It is also an extremely valuable historic piece and was designated a National Treasure in 1999.

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Hon-do (main hall)

sen.j: 木造空也上人立像
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Kuya Jonin
Wooden standing statue of Kuya Jonin
Wooden standing statue of Kuya Jonin

sen.j: 鎌倉時代、運慶の四男・康勝の作。
sen.e: Crafted in the Kamakura period by Kosho, the fourth son of Unkei.
Crafted in the Kamakura period by Kosho, the fourth son of Unkei.
Crafted in the Kamakura period by Kosho, the fourth son of Unkei.

sen.j: 僧侶の肖像彫刻は坐像に表すものが多いが、本像はわらじ履きで歩く空也の姿を表している。
sen.e: There are many statues of that depict monks sitting down, but this statue shows Kuya walking in straw sandals.
There are many statues of that depict monks sitting down, but this statue shows Kuya walking in straw sandals.
There are many statues of that depict monks sitting down, but this statue shows Kuya walking in straw sandals.

sen.j: 疫病が蔓延していた京の街中を、空也が鉦（かね）を鳴らし、念仏を唱えながら悪疫退散を祈りつつ歩くさまを迫真の描写力で表現している。
sen.e: It vividly depicts Kuya walking through the plague-ridden streets of Kyoto sounding a bell and chanting the name of Buddha while praying for an end to the epidemic.
It vividly depicts Kuya walking through the plague-ridden streets of Kyoto sounding a bell and chanting the name of Buddha while praying for an end to the epidemic.
It vividly depicts Kuya walking through the plague-ridden streets of Kyoto sounding a bell and chanting the name of Buddha while praying for an end to the epidemic.

sen.j: 空也は首から鉦を下げ、右手には鉦を叩くための撞木（しゅもく）、左手には鹿の角のついた杖をもっている。
sen.e: Kuya is shown wearing the bell around his neck, holding the wooden bell hammer with which to hit it in his right hand, and clutching a staff with a deer horn on the top in his left hand.
Kuya is shown wearing the bell around his neck, holding the wooden bell hammer with which to hit it in his right hand, and clutching a staff with a deer horn on the top in his left hand.
Kuya is shown wearing the bell around his neck, holding the wooden bell hammer with which to hit it in his right hand, and clutching a staff with a deer horn on the top in his left hand.

sen.j: 空也の口からは6体の阿弥陀仏の小像が吐き出されている。
sen.e: Six miniature statues of Amidabha Buddha are being emitted from Kuya's mouth.
sen.cmt: ・Amidabha Buddha: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Six miniature statues of Amidabha Buddha are being emitted from Kuya's mouth.
Six miniature statues of Amidabha Buddha are being emitted from Kuya's mouth.

sen.j: 6体の阿弥陀仏は「南無阿弥陀仏」の6字を象徴し、念仏を唱えるさまを視覚的に表現している。
sen.e: The six Amida Buddhas symbolize the six words of the 'Na Mu A Mi Da Butsu' chant and serve to visually represent his chanting of the Buddha's name.
The six Amida Buddhas symbolize the six words of the 'Na Mu A Mi Da Butsu' chant and serve to visually represent his chanting of the Buddha's name.
The six Amida Buddhas symbolize the six words of the 'Na Mu A Mi Da Butsu' chant and serve to visually represent his chanting of the Buddha's name.

sen.j: 六体の小像は針金でつながっている。
sen.e: The six miniature statues are connected by wire.
The six miniature statues are connected by wire.
The six miniature statues are connected by wire.

sen.j: 木造僧形坐像（伝・平清盛像）

sen.e: Kamakura period.

sen.j: 平清盛とされる経を持った僧形の像である。
sen.e: A statue of a Buddhist monk, taken to be TAIRA no Kiyomori, holding scriptures.
A statue of a Buddhist monk, taken to be TAIRA no Kiyomori, holding scriptures.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代。
sen.e: Kamakura period

sen.j: 銘文はないが、伝来、作風等から運慶の真作とされる像。
sen.e: There is no inscription but the statue is believed to be an original piece by Unkei due to its origin and style.
There is no inscription but the statue is believed to be an original piece by Unkei due to its origin and style.
There is no inscription but the statue is believed to be an original piece by Unkei due to its origin and style.

sen.j: 運慶一族の菩提寺である地蔵十輪院に伝来した。
sen.e: It was brought from Unkei's family temple Jizo Jurin-in.
It was brought from Unkei's family temple, Jizo Jurin-in Temple.
It was brought from Unkei's family temple, Jizo Jurin-in Temple.

sen.j: 理知的でさわやかな表情、切れ味するどい衣文などと評される作風が運慶作とされる理由である。
sen.e: Believed to be an Unkei piece due to its intellectual graceful expression and the sharp craftsmanship of the clothing.
Believed to be an Unkei piece due to its intellectual graceful expression and the sharp craftsmanship of the clothing.
Believed to be an Unkei piece due to its intellectual graceful expression and the sharp craftsmanship of the clothing.

sen.j: 木造伝・運慶坐像、伝・湛慶坐像
sen.e: Wooden sitting statues of Unkei and Tankei
Wooden sitting statues of Unkei and Tankei
Wooden sitting statues of Unkei and Tankei

sen.j: 鎌倉時代。
sen.e: Kamakura period.
Kamakura period.
Kamakura period

sen.j: 日本仏像彫刻史上もっとも有名な仏師親子の肖像彫刻とされている。
sen.e: Statues of the best known father and son Buddhist statue makers in the history of Japanese Buddhist statuary.
Statues of the best known father and son Buddhist statue makers in the history of Japanese Buddhist statuary.
Statues of the best known father and son Buddhist statue makers in the history of Japanese Buddhist statuary.

sen.j: 精悍な伝・湛慶像と、老いてまだまだ盛んな巨匠といった風貌の伝・運慶像とそれぞれの個性が表現されている。
sen.e: Each statue displays its own personality with the determined young Tankei and the old master Unkei.
Each statue displays its own personality with the determined young Tankei and the old master Unkei who looks hale and hearty despite his age.
sen.cmt: "老いてまだまだ盛んな"部分が抜けているので補足。
sen.e: Each statue displays its own personality with the determined young Tankei and the old master Unkei who looks hale and hearty despite his age.

sen.j: 前記の地蔵菩薩坐像とともに地蔵十輪院に伝わった。
sen.e: They were received from Jizo Jurin-in Temple along with the above-mentioned Wooden sitting statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha.
sen.cmt: 原文の「前期」を「前記」に訂正
sen.e: They were received from Jizo Jurin-in Temple along with the above-mentioned Wooden sitting statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha.

sen.e: Wooden standing statues of the Four Heavenly Kings
Wooden standing statues of the Four Heavenly Kings - Heian period.

sen.j: 本尊の十一面観音像とともに、空也による創建期の遺作である。
sen.e: Along with the eleven-face Kannon statue principal image, these pieces are remains from the time of the temple's founding by Kuya.
Along with the eleven-face Kannon statue principal image, these pieces are remains from the time of the temple's founding by Kuya.
Along with the eleven-face Kannon statue principal image, these pieces are remains from the time of the temple's founding by Kuya.

sen.j: 宝物収蔵庫には4体のうちの持国天像と増長天像が安置され、残りの広目天像と多聞天像は京都国立博物館に寄託されている。
sen.e: Of the 4 statues, those of Dhrtarastra and Virudhaka are housed in the treasure hall, while those of Virupaksa and Vaisravana are deposited at Kyoto National Museum.
Of the 4 statues, those of Dhrtarastra and Virudhaka are housed in the treasure hall, while those of Virupaksa and Vaisravana are deposited at Kyoto National Museum.
Of the four statues, those of Dhrtarastra and Virudhaka are housed in the treasure hall, while those of Virupaksa and Vaisravana are deposited at Kyoto National Museum.

sen.j: 4体のうち、増長天像のみは鎌倉時代の補作である。
sen.e: Only the statue of Virudhaka is an addition made in the Kamakura period.
Only the statue of Virudhaka is an addition made in the Kamakura period.
Only the statue of Virudhaka is an addition made in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 木造薬師如来坐像
sen.e: Wooden sitting statue of Bhaisajyaguru
Wooden sitting statue of Bhaisajyaguru

sen.j: 平安時代。
sen.e: Heian period.
Heian period.
Heian period

sen.j: 天台様式がみられ、中信による中興時の像と考えられる。
sen.e: Exhibits the Tendai style and is believed to date from the period of renovation carried out by Chushin.
Exhibits the Tendai style and is believed to date from the period of renovation carried out by Chushin.

sen.j: 左手に頭髪を持ち、鬘掛（かつらかけ）地蔵と呼ばれ信仰されている。
sen.e: The statue, which holds hair in its left hand, is known as the 'Wig-wearing Ksitigarbha'.

sen.j: 『今昔物語集』にもこの像に関する説話が取り上げられるなど、古来著名な像である。
sen.e: It has been renowned since ancient times, even being referred to in 'Konjaku Monogatarishu' (Anthology of Tales from the Past).

sen.j: その他、重要有形民俗文化財として、泥塔、皇服茶碗、版木、萬燈会関係用具二千百余点などがある
sen.e: In addition, the temple is in possession of Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties which include a mud pagoda, Obuku-chawan (tea ceremony bowl for New Year's Shugicha), wooden printing blocks and materials related to the Mando-e (Buddhist lantern festival).
sen.cmt: ・Obuku-chawan (tea ceremony bowl for New Year's Shugicha): http://www.tochiya.com/jisyo/imi/o.html
sen.e: In addition, the temple is in possession of Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties which include a mud pagoda, Obuku-chawan (tea ceremony bowl for New Year's Shugicha), wooden printing blocks and over 2100 materials related to the Mando-e (Buddhist lantern festival).

In addition, the temple is in possession of Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties which include a mud pagoda, Obuku-chawan (tea ceremony bowl for New Year's Shugicha), wooden printing blocks and over 2100 materials related to the Mando-e (Buddhist lantern festival).
